div.h2: Donation Station – Cash and Toiletries Collection!
div.p: Because so many colleges and businesses are finding it necessary to close in an effort to curtail the spread of COVID-19, many people are losing their time at work and thus their income. For those of us in a more fortunate position, this is a good time to offer extra contributions to local resources who are providing support for struggling families.

We have been in touch with the Survival Center in Northampton, The Goshen Pantry and the Easthampton Community Center and they are all grateful to accept whatever we have to offer. They are especially interested in cash, which they can leverage into large food purchases, followed by toiletries (dental products, deodorant, feminine hygiene, soaps and lotions or shampoos – either of which can be “gently used”), and non-perishable food items.

We don’t usually collect cash at Donation Station, but in this case, we want to make participation as easy as possible, so in the Family Corner at school we will accept money, toiletries or food for all of March, and distribute them among the three centers.
Thanks so much for your generous participation.
